intro: Tithymalus micractinus, commonly known as the small-leaved tithymalus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, often clustered leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically arranged in umbels, a common feature in the carrot family. It is native to parts of Europe and prefers moist, shaded habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
